Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the 1918 Spanish Flu outbreak was caused by the H1N1 virus with genes of avian origin, according to the CDC.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of an experimental bacterial meningitis vaccine as the cause of the 1918 Spanish Flu outbreak.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no indication of the claim faltering at times in the provided information.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is contradicted by expert opinions and scientific evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the experimental bacterial meningitis vaccine caused the 1918 Spanish Flu outbreak without sufficient evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the 1918 Spanish Flu outbreak was caused by the H1N1 virus with genes of avian origin, as supported by scientific consensus.
